reviews.review_msg: So 320 is super easy with this guy. He makes everything super simple and easy to understand. Genuinely is concerned about his students' understanding of the material. Almost weekly assignments and quizzes like the other profs but wayyyyy easier. Midterm was also super easy... class average of 74%

This class is no joke. Lectures are long & fast.. when he gives u a break, take it, go get air, content makes u feel like u can't breathe. Expect quizzes, hw, exams. He is nice but very inconsistent with material. Does not seem to take TA opinions into consideration. The TAs know what us students need. Maybe he should TA this before he teaches
Always really good about being really willing to answer questions and responding to emails.  Super good.

Kylie is able to breakdown and explain difficult concepts in a way that is easy to understand. As a student, I found her to be very approachable and she was always willing to take time to ensure I had a thorough understanding regarding assignments & exams. She is a fair marker and her approach to teaching shows that she cares about her students.

Kylie is one of the worst TA's ive ever had at SFU. she is very rude when it comes to responding to emails and graded the research proposal like the class are experts in the field of research. at least she has her looks going for her though

Professor Maaike is a wonderful professor that really cares for the students. This course is very hard so you really need to put in the work. Some tips: watch the online tutorial videos + read the textbook for each assignment, it will really help. Cheat sheets are allowed for exams. Professor Maaike does a lot to ensure that students pass!

If crim320 is available with Maaike, take it. She took out 3 of our lowest quiz grades and allowed 1 full cheat sheet (front and back) for both the midterm and the final. Just follow the SPSS videos she provides on Canvas and you will do well on the assignments.

Amazing class, Dr. Helmus teaches this class in a clear manner and is very helpful. The SPSS assignments were confusing at times but make sure to review the TA's videos as it provides step-by-step instructions. The midterm and final were very reasonable and Helmus asks fair questions. Make sure to read the text before the quizzes. Ask questions!!

Takes so long for assignment grades to be released that by the time you have to submit the second assignment, you haven't even gotten the grade back for the first one. Because of this if you did something wrong on the first assignment without knowing, you'll most likely have done the same thing on the second one. Domino effect of bad grades

Dr. Helmus is one of the best teachers I've had at SFU! I wasn't expecting a stats class to go over well, but she taught in a clear, engaging manner. There were two textbooks but you didn't need to use one at all (which she tells you upfront). Lots of opportunities for extra credit and she is very accommodating!

The lectures were very long and somewhat confusing. Thankfully the midterm and final were online so we could use our notes. If the tests were not online I think 80% of the class would have failed. The tests were still hard online. Make sure you do a good job on the asingments as this will be what boosts your grade.

Well... Prof Helmus has been a nightmare for Crim318. Super disorganized, she had 2 guest speakers who contradicted her slide contents mid-lecture. She never respected a deadline and submitted the grades for the first paper 5 weeks later (this delayed the paper 2 deadline... overlapping with final exams), super disorganized course. regret taking it

Maaike is a great professor who cares about what she does and her students. She is very accommodating and understanding of students' situations, and she provides help and support when it's needed. She teaches straight to the point which means the lectures are easy to understand. weekly assignments are a bit time consuming, but not hard!

Maaike is very good at explaining tough statistical concepts and making them easy to understand. Her exams and assignments are fair. I wish I took this class before STAT 203. She is awesome, CRIM 320 isn't an easy course by any means, but with her clear instructions and lectures, you can do amazing if you put in the work.

If you have to take CRIM320, take it with Maaike! I am not a stats/math person, but she makes the difficult concepts easy to comprehend. She gives up to 2% bonus for sending her questions after lectures and her assignments have videos which explain exactly how to do them. She is an amazing professor and I would definitely have her as a prof again!

Take this class! I took Prof Helmus and she was amazing. Statistics isn't my favourite topic but the way this class was taught made me actually enjoy it. She provided engaging, in-depth lectures and the assignments really helped me understand how to apply what we learned. Also, her BTVS themed examples during class made me rewatch the show!

I have taken CRIM 320 by Garth before but I did not do well as I hoped for, and so I retook it under Maaike as my instructor. Maaike is a REAL GEM! The class was well structured, with lectures that are engaging, easy to follow, and hilarious at times. The assignments are EASY if you follow the instructions well that was also recorded by the TAs.

I'm gonna be very honest, one of the worst classes that I have ever had. the assignments and lectures don't relate at all, she gives formulas and then says, you don't need to know them after talking about them for 10 min. It so confusing overall, nothing relates to anything and she doesn't explain the things we need to know well Also SO many emails

I thoroughly enjoyed taking CRIM320 with Maaike. She made the class a lot of fun and all of her assignments are designed to make the course content clearer. Her lectures are very engaging and her teaching style elaborates the course content really well. A lot of help is available for the assignments. Will definitely recommend. Also, she's hilarious

Maaike was extremely accessible outside of class and for those who needed help. She gave great opportunities for extra marks. Her final exam was extra hard due to it being an open book exam. I personally enjoyed having an extra challenging exam. She ended up scaling the marks so on average people did better than previous years' exams. amazing prof.

she is the worst prof I've had the past 4 years at SFU. I had her for 103 as well and she was just as vague and unfair. she terribly mishandled the pandemic and turned a blind eye to students w/ hardships. it does not matter how much you study for her exams, unless ur writing it according to her criteria you won't get the mark. AVOID at all cost.

The final was super unfair, it was made way too long and much harder due to the pandemic. I have lost all respect for Dr. Helmus and she clearly does not care about her students. Worst class I have ever taken in my 4 years at SFU. The assignments were fair and we are able to do extra work for bonus credit. But I cannot get past the messed up final.

Professor Helmus did give an opportunity for an extra two percent which I would say is a positive. However, the final for 320 was the most unfair final I have ever taken in all my three years at sfu. As people said before she acts like she cares but she doesnt. Assignments are marked so harshly and only given rúbric after you get them back.

Agree with previous posts: she acts like she cares, but doesn't. After the pandemic she makes the final extremely harder and impossible to complete in the given time. Would be shocked if the average for that final was above 40 %. I have been preparing a long time and it was the most difficult test I've ever taken, so hopefully it gets curved.

She acts like she cares a lot, but lowkey doesn't. There are many assignments throughout the semester and unclear instructions. Some of my assignments were graded so poorly, and she didn't provide feedback even when i emailed and appealed by grade. Her exams are fair, she tests everything and even takes questions from the practice exams.

Made the best out of what otherwise is a bland class. Great Buffy the Vampire examples in class. Tests and assignments are fair. Very approachable during office hours. If you have a chance to take a class with her I would recommend it

Maaike was extremely accessible and helpful, although she could benefit from slowing down the examples. Despite this, Maaike provided a structured criteria, and plenty of chances to improve/boost marks (optional assignment, extra 2% opportunity, and final exam that overrules midterm). She was more than fair for how dreaded the class is.

Maaike was a phenomenal prof! She took a bland and boring class that, when taught by another prof last year, was at least 5 times more difficult. She cares about students succeeding and caters the statistics aspect of the course to criminology students. She is also SO FUNNY. Her memes and pictures on her lecture slides were appreciated :)
Had Ryan as a TA for Martin's 320 class and he was amazing. Made all the tutorial's super easy to understand and was happy to go over things again if we missed it the first time around.

The material itself is not too hard, but you'd still lose marks no matter if you followed the instructions. If Edith is your TA, I strongly recommend switching out if you can. Both the professor and the TA (Edith) had a noticeable attitude and would even snicker during exams, which felt unprofessional and immature.

The class was not as bad as it was made it out to be. It was hard to stay engaged during lecture due to the slow lecturing and dry materials but examples given for each concept really help in understanding, making it relatively easy. Overall, Cristina is not bad, you can tell she cares but could benefit from clearer criteria for grading on exams.

No clear grading criteria or no clear assignment criteria. On exams, she wants it word for word, what she says when she doesn't tell you that. She's constantly contradicting herself. Her TAs are not allowed to help students, her syllabus doesn't state everything she wants students to follow. her teaching style is extremely bad. No leeway.
She's not accommodating at all. Lectures are boring as well. The other reviews on here are correct about her. Wouldn't suggest.

Lectures are boring, it doesn't help that Professor Pastia speaks very slowly. One thing I noticed is that she switches the slides too fast which makes it so much worse. Overall, I'd say avoid. The Tutorials are easy and enjoyable, but the 2-hour lecture with her teaching style? Yikes.

This class was terrible. Unclear expectations on homework assignments. You could do everything your told to do but they will just take marks off if it's not written precisely how they want it. It did not matter if you studied hard for the mid-term exam because the questions were totally unrelated to what you are taught in the course.

Absurd amount of questions for the time given on exams. Says 30 questions, 3 hrs but then gives about 14 sub questions on maybe 10 of the questions. Not certain on 10 cuz u cant finish her exams. Prob works out to 1min or less per question which is insane considering calculation questions. Take off lots of part marks so u fail on correct answers.

Kinda comes across as rude and passive aggressive in emails to the class and one-on-one. If they tell you to be concise dont listen to them cuz they'll take a lot of marks off for not including everything thats related

No effort put into this course by the prof, the lectures are pre-recorded by another prof and the tutorial videos are probably done in that way too. They just dont care about students, feedback, concerns, brush off mass emails. Grading is unfair and unclear. U could do everything ur told to, criteria will add something unrelated to questions.

CRIM320 is a difficult and boring class, but Cristina is really good explaining things in a understandable and useful way. She comes across a little tough at first, but is really friendly and willing to help if you ask. Cristina is one of the best TAs I've had at SFU.

Aviod this proffesor at all costs, even if you show up to class everyday you will still fail. I passed every test with great marks but however failed his essay. Hes a tough marker and not worth it. I regret taking his class.

This class is hard, but it's manageable. Make sure to show up for every lecture and don't miss the tutorial because that's where you will learn how to use SPSS for your assignments. If you don't understand something, ask for help ASAP cause each lecture sorta builds on the last one. Be prepared to stay close to the full 3 hours for the final exam!!

Chris is one of the best Crim profs I've had at SFU. He really takes the time to make sure his students understand the lecture material and answers all questions (even if you ask 20 stupid questions). The material is not easy and exams are worth 65 percent of your grade but if you ask Chris for help and work hard, it's pretty hard not to do well.

Chris often zips through lectures b/c there's a lot of material to get through, but  ALWAYS answers EVERY student's questions. Most helpful and approachable prof I've had in crim. 2 exams and 6 SPSS assignments. Exams were long and require a lot of detail (final was 30 pages and 3 hours! MT avg was 68). Overall, great prof, decently hard exams.

Chris is a great prof!  If you put in the effort on his assignments you will do well on his exams they are similar. He tells you exactly what you will be tested on.  Reading prior to class and going to class is super important if you miss lectures it might be difficult to understand what he is looking for.

Not sure why there are so many negative reviews. He is incredibly helpful in office hours, and genuinely do want his students to succeed. He does lack clarity in terms of explaining some of the concepts and goes by them really fast, but to his merit he actively encourages people to ask questions in class and to come see him.

Those that find Chris condensive must be sensitive people. He will help you if you show him you work hard (prepared) and ask proper questions. He's exremely helpful in his office hours, crunches study time by 50%. Also, you must attend class and tutorial because it prepares you for the exam, no joke! He's not hard at all.

It's a hard class but you got to put in work and you'll be rewarded, ask questions and he will clarify  instead of just thinking you'll get it later you won't. I thought he was completely fair and very easy to approach Show up to class there is ALOT of stuff that the textbook just barely touches upon. Great prof hard material show up and take notes

He is very knowledgeable in the subject however he is a very condescending person. He doesn't seem to understand why students struggle with the subject but yet he still makes condescending comments at them whenever they ask him questions during the lecture. To his credit, he will hold extra office hours if you need extra help.
Very helpful TA. Knew her stats and knew how to explain them in an understandable way. Plus, she is smokin hot.

I took this class with a perception in mind that it would be brutal, given the reviews here, but it turned out to be the opposite. Martin was accommodating when I asked for two extensions. The TA, Sara was super helpful and timely in email responses and helped me otherwise too. If you put in the work, this course will be enjoyable! :)
Crim 320 is not an easy class but Martin tries his best not to make it more painful than necessary. Try your best on the midterm and labs because the final is brutal. The TAs were amazing.

His workbook and textbook are entirely useless, as is attending lecture. The labs are easy enough if you attend tutorial, the TAs are awesome. Martin doesn't seem to want students to succeed, we are expected to read his mind for what he wants to see in lab write ups and we were not given nearly enough time for the midterm.

Seemed good at first, but his assignments give you zero direction and the corresponding textbook and workbook do no t help you to the extent needed to succeed. I didn't mind the way be taught but he would ramble in too much. The tests were terrible. Not enough time to complete with no option to look at the entire exam. Exams online and open book.

If you are good at teaching yourself you will do well in the course.  There is not enough time given for exams, both had the strongest weighted questions left to the end with no option of going back to previous questions.  Regardless, it is a simple stats course so if you do the work you will do well, the professor does not help in your learning.

The class content was hard but Martin just makes it worse. Extremely boring, uninteresting, and useless lectures. His textbook and instructions in the workbook for weekly assignments are unclear and confusing. The tests were extremely difficult with not enough time to even finish them. He is also extremely passive aggressive in emails.
textbook/workbook is a joke, full of spelling errors and very hard to follow along with, I recommend not taking this class with him if you have the chance to

Listen to everyone, do not take his class if you have other options. You have to buy his books on a platform that doesn't even support zooming in, lectures are sorta political, and the tutorials (at the time) are pretty much a catch up block. Weekly lab's don't have a clear criteria as well as the tests. Don't bother with his class
Very disrespectful to students with an ego. And very unapologetic for anything.

Meh is the experience with this prof. he's not bad, but TA Sara is really helpful. What made me mad was how he promised to curve our grades but didn't, and as per his own grading scale. i should have gotten an A-, but ended with a B. Whatever.

He changes his course this semester to make it better for students and while this helped the overall grade of the students he would not round at the end of the semester if you were on the cusp of the next letter grade because we reached the max 70% of students have a B- or higher. he also said he would mark on the curve but then he did not.

Class was blended but we only ended up having 3 IRL lectures because of how he scheduled the course (eg he cancelled class to attend conferences). He was engaging in person but not online. The tests were tough but he scaled the end grades to make it fair. Didn't need to attend labs because the workbook he wrote gave step-by-step instructions.

If you scroll back on this prof rating you can see that in the past, he had positive reviews. I mean this wholeheartedly when I say something serious must have happened in his life for someone to turn so bitter and disrespectful. Online tests had problems and he said "not my problem, its IT" and would not help students/ got mad at US!?? AVOID HIM!

The most difficult prof taken at SFU. He is rude, does not accommodate, and is disrespectful. I am surprised in why the crim faculty has allowed him to continue teaching this course when a majority of students are struggling every term. I have felt disrespected and ashamed and does not support his students in doing well. Avoid at all costs.

literally the WORST prof Ive taken and this is my last semester... He is totally disengaged from his student. I really hope he does some work to reengage with his work and students because I think everyone struggled this term under his instruction, or lack there of. He seems like a good guy- idk why he would treat his students so poorly
DONT TAKE A CLASS WITH MARTIN. I can honestly say hes the worst prof in crim at sfu

First time I've had to drop a course this far into the semester. The workbook, written by the prof, was so informally written that it was impossible to follow along with. It felt like there were more jokes incorporated than actual course content. Also, he uses a different statistical program than the TAs, so it was more difficult than it had to be.

Confirmed why I worried taking this class with this professor based on experiences heard from others. For one of his exams he did not take any responsibility over his own mistakes (iykyk) leading to many students to be negatively impacted by it. Overall: difficult class/content, not enough room to improve, and no compassion from the professor.
Good luck to everyone taking this class...imagine taking a class with a prof who is proud that his class average is 50ish% Dont take this class alone! Suffer together!

Do not take 320 with Martin...he seemed to have little investment in his students or the class. 

The second online test had a malfunction and there was no one (no TA or Martin) available during the test to help. Little was done to make up for their mistake despite them wasting our time

I would advise potential students to seek alternative options if they want an effective and engaging learning experience. Professor Andresen does not provide the support or quality of education one should expect from a university instructor.
the worst
talks about random things off-topic in lecture and says to watch his recorded lectures that he filmed years ago to learn the material

Terrible prof, might be the worst prof i have ever had. Very unprofessional, rude to students, and does not inform students of anything. The test is unreasonably difficult, and he does not inform students of what to expect with the exam. Do not take a course with him if you want a good semester he will ruin it.
unfair exams

The grading for lab assignment is very unclear and lack detailed instruction on what you need to get all the marks, so you are always losing marks no matter what. He should really update his workbook that you need for your lab assignments (you have to pay for it). You shouldn't skip the tutorial, as the workbook can be useless for most terms.

Martin is a nice guy and very knowledgeable about statistics however, his classes were hard to sit through and his slides were very bland. His midterm was fair but his final was harsh and heavily focused on labs. Be ready to put in the work for this class and try not to fall asleep during lectures.

He is a nice guy but his lectures were just a summary of his textbook so they were not useful. Labs were only helpful if you had a good TA. The averages for the exams are 50% and currently failing our final. The exam questions are very hard and focus on definitions, lab material and multiple choice.

Martin himself seems like a nice guy, however, he makes his exams unreasonably hard. During the first lecture he specified that the average for exams is 50%. If that many students are barely passing the exam, then maybe the problem is your teaching style and not the course content. I got an A+ in previous Statistics courses, barely passing now.

Martin is a nice enough guy and likes to joke around. His lectures were extremely bland and consisted exclusively of excerpts from his textbook (brutal read).
He seems to be knowledgable on statistical testing, but was not successful in teaching the content during lecture. Lecture and teaching style not conducive to understanding statistics.

This is considered a dry class and a lot of students didn't do well so it was actually the first time I had a grade curved. He is very knowledgeable and knows what he's doing as he actually conducts research. Super funny and always told us hilarious stories to make this class bearable. The class itself is hard if you don't work hard for it.
One of the greatest professor at Sfu. He is really helpful. Taking his Crim 320 class is highly recommended.

This is my second time taking crim 320 (online was a nightmare) and so far I can say that Steph is the best prof ive had in along time. Lectures are extremely important as that is where she draws her exam material from. Assignments are clearly outlined and quizzes are fair if you attend tutorials. definitely a solid 8-9 in the looks category aswell

I have dreaded taking 320 for a long time but Steph has definitely made it more enjoyable. She is friendly and supportive. It is hard class but she tries her best to explain it in the simplest way.  That being said, the exams are hard BUT if you work hard, just like any other class, you will do well. Would definitely take a class with Steph again!

Absolute worst professor I've had. Does not provide lecture slides beyond the graphics/tables used for examples. Exams are incredibly hard and she refuses to scale them. Hard to understand, and TA Cristina was hard to approach for help and was condescending to those who tried to ask for help. Unless you're good at stats, you'll struggle with Steph.

The thing I did not enjoy about Steph was how fast she lectured. That said, her lectures are recorded and were lifesaving for the exams. I found this class to be one of my easier ones, but maybe it is because I did well in STATS 203 previously. The class is straight-forward and Steph does her best to be clear when explaining concepts. Recommend!

Steph tries her very best to explain all this bland and boring information by giving plenty of examples. Her exams were basically based on the lectures and she even, at times, hints to you what will appear on the exam. Recorded her lectures so it really helped when it came to reviewing. Overall, more pros than cons in my view and she's a beaut!!

This is the hardest course I have ever taken at SFU! Steph is very knowledgable and clear which makes it easier to understand lectures. But she talks really fast. Class average was 56% for the midterm and I studied so hard and only got 56%. I can't imagine how the final exam will be like and assignment criteria is not clear and hard.

This class is tough to begin with, but Steph does a good job explaining it in a way that is clear and makes sense. She is also super helpful when you have a question, and will clarify things in a way that you understand. I think that people complaining about her would say the same thing for any prof, stats sucks no matter who's teaching it.

The most monotone and uninteresting prof. She makes herself so unapproachable by saying no talking to her during lecture breaks. Unclear criteria for assignments, boring lectures, brutal midterm. Avoid avoid avoid!!! Makes a hard class even harder. Can only imagine what the final exam will be like in a few weeks....
Boring class. Fair test. Fair marker. Hard material. very very very very good looking.

This class is no joke. Steph is my TA for this course. She makes it SO much more bearable. The amount of questions & emails she gets must be a lot more than the usual class. GREAT attitude always, very knowledgeable, amazing email response times, very willing to help students, genuinely cares. She's a GEM!! Someone give her an award.

Sara is amazing, I would not be able to make it through 320 without her. She really cares about your success if you show up and put in the effort. She is kind and patient and makes sure that you understand what's going on before moving on.
Sara and the TA Hana are really helpful for this class! It's a hard one, but they both made it very manageable
Sara was really kind when I needed extra accommodations in the course, very understanding and helpful instructor.

Sara gives a lot of feedback on assignments and goes over what she expects to see on assignments in labs. She makes sure we are all keeping up when learning SPSS, and stops if someone is confused until they catch up. I don't think I would have been able to get the grade I did without her help!
if you have her as your ta, switch asap.

The fact that she's on zoom in essentials hoodies says enough about how chill she is, but Sara is so nice and really does a good job of explaining concepts and makes online learning so much less confusing! Makes you feel so much less stressed about stats after meetings

Sara was an awesome TA, and responded to emails quickly and really knows the material. She always said hi to my friends and I in the halls and was really nice. And shes just an awesome TA overall, especially for stats!

Had her as a TA for Crim 320 and she is by far the best TA I've every encountered. She is so caring and helpful and was extremely fair with her grading. Any mark deducted was justified and explained. TAKE ANY CLASS SHE IS TA-ING FOR AS SHE LITERALLY MAKES YOUR DAY BETTER. She helps students readily and just an amazing person overall!!!

Having labs with Sara was super helpful and probably the only reason that I passed 320. She always knew the answers to our questions, and gave feedback to help us improve. She really cared about students, and was an awesome ta to have

One of the hardest classes I've ever taken at SFU, but also the one I've probably learnt the most from. I'm actually glad that this was a core course because I would not have taken it otherwise. This class is demanding, but the way Rebecca teaches makes it easier. She cares about her students and if you try, she'll try even harder.

By far the best tutorial teacher I have ever had in my five years of university! She is so helpful and goes above and beyond for all of her students. There is no way I could have got through this class without her. SO thankful!
One of my fav teacher assistants ever. She is so helpful and explains the course material clearly. If you can...TAKE THIS CLASS WITH REBECCA!! :)

Rebecca is super helpful.  She is always at school and willing to go out of her way to explain.  She uses humor in order to make the lectures interesting.  There is no need to be fearful or have hate towards this class, If you read the text, pay attention, LISTEN, and review the class is fine.

She is the worst instructor for stats. She rambles on talking concepts that she fails to explain. If you go to her for help, she will give you generalized comments. It is like she expects you to understand the material fully because she finds it so simple. She comes off as patronizing.

Best prof for CRIM 320. Helpful and funny. Makes the ultra-dry quantitative material easier to understand.  Assignments take lots of effort but still do-able. Exams are all right. Take 320 with Rebecca if you can.

Horrible teacher. Thinks she is good, but not at all. Not very helpful. Always gets off class early to smoke. Not good at explaining concepts. Talks way too much about irrelevant things, like about her life which no one cares about. In general, just horrible. Thinks she is funny but not. she is not the best looking professor. under qualified.
My fave TA so far! she is down to earth, funny and very helpful!

Seems almost incoherent at times. When you ask her questions, she talks about stuff that isn't even relevant then expects you to just know. Of course she's a better lecturer than Bryan Kinney but she's not as great as a TA as she is teaching. Very unhelpful. Says she posts notes, and doesn't do it till the day before the exam? Really?

When lecturing Crim 320 Rebecca is very unclear and not great at explaining Statistical concepts. I have also gone to her with questions in which she said she did not have time to answer (needed to go out for a smoke). She TA's the class as well as one other person and all of the people who have her as a TA as well complain about her clarity
The class sucks, but she is an awesome TA and tries her best to be helpful in tutorials.

Never take this course through distance, esp. if she's TM-ing. Never responds to mail in time. I had to hand in an assignment where I needed help and she didn't reply. She was the sole instructor for the course. Instructors have an obligation to respond to emails promptly, especially if  the course is through distance. Not recommended.

Unlike alot of TM's she knows what she talking about which is very important with a class such as this.. she goes out of her way to help students and above and beyond the call of a TM...plus she is very personable and funny...
Christine is a genuinely nice person. Definitely made 320 class bearable.

Christine is wonderful and really cares for her students. She really wants to see people succeed and is always available to help. Just as an added bonus, she is always super energetic and ready to start the day off with a smile no matter what!

Christine is amazing! She makes 320 (a very difficult course) very clear. Her ability to bring the material to a level where students can understand has been seriously appreciated. She also replies to emails promptly and holds study parties with candy. Christine, you saved my GPA!

Christine TA-ed this course many times. She is one of the main reasons students survive this mandatory course. ALWAYS willing to help students, she would put her life on hold if u need help. SO knowledgable, GENUINELY CARES, goes the extra mile, hosts study parties(wow), want students to succeed, emails back asap. Rare gem.. So rare. Bless you girl
